byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Andrew Kramer, Thomas Erdbrink, Christopher Drew, Jack Ewing and Bill Vlasic.
byline.original: By NICOLA CLARK and CLIFFORD KRAUSS

abstract: Airbus says it is in discussions with Iran over sale of dozens of new commercial aircraft, among first of new international business agreements for country since it agreed to nuclear deal; companies in United States express caution in dealing with Iran.
lead_paragraph: Airbus orders, likely to be partly financed with loans from European export-credit agencies, could be announced as early as this week, an official said.

headline.main: Iran’s Sanctions Lift, and the West Goes to Talk Business
headline.print_headline: Now the West Talks Business With Iranians

snippet: Airbus orders, likely to be partly financed with loans from European export-credit agencies, could be announced as early as this week, an official said.
